text.p: These are the leading stories in the Beirut press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-The five-nation ceasefire deal monitoring group will meet today to discuss a Lebanese complaint about Israeli shelling of civilian areas in south Lebanon on Sunday.
-Economic activity grew in August, and the balance of payments surplus on a year-on-year basis was $286 million.
-The new cabinet will be formed within two days; it will consist of 22 MPs and eight dignitaries.
-Security forces seized 130 kg of cocaine and arrested 14 dealers and addicts.
-Bank of Lebanon's latest monthly bulletin reported that net public debt rose to 14,392.7 billion Lebanese pounds in August.
-Christian Maronite Patriarch Sfeir heads to Vatican tomorrow.
-The weekly treasury bills issue reached 1,057 billion pounds, the highest level attained in a year.
-The trial of 25 people accused of working for the Israeli Mossad resumed yesterday and five suspects in custody deny the charges.
-Israeli forces strafe with machinegunfire areas north of the eastern sector of the Israeli-held zone in south Lebanon.
